Pedro, this is not a problem with XMLUnit. It is a problem with the way
you are using JUnit.

You must put your test case class (MyXMLTestCase) into the CLASSPATH of
the <junit> (or <java>) task you use to execute your tests.

Please consult the JUnit FAQ (Google "JUnit FAQ") if you need more details.

Good luck.

One more thing: when you post messages they are moderated, so do not
post the same message many times. Someone has to approve them before you
see them on the list. Thank you.
